title: Week in Pictures: Brazil protests, Hurricane Dorian, cricket
text:
ABC News photo editors chose the best news images of the week for this collection. </br></br>Volunteers rescue several families on small boats from the rising waters of Hurricane Dorian, near the Casuarina Bridge in Freeport, Bahamas, Sept. 3, 2019. The storm's punishing winds and muddy brown floodwaters devastated thousands of homes, crippled hospitals and trapped people. Ramon Espinosa/AP

Damage caused by Hurricane Dorian is seen in Marsh Harbour on Great Abaco Island, Sept. 4, 2019, in the Bahamas. A massive rescue effort is underway after Hurricane Dorian spent more than a day inching over the Bahamas, killing several as entire communities were flattened, roads washed out and hospitals and airports swamped by several feet of water. Scott Olson/Getty Images

Match referee Kevin Friend gives a yellow card to Jack Grealish of Aston Villa, left, during the Premier League match between Crystal Palace and Aston Villa at Selhurst Park, Aug. 31, 2019, in London. Bryn Lennon/Getty Images

Climbers make their way along the Yoshida trail toward the summit of Mount Fuji, as the glow from the town's lights are visible through clouds, Aug. 2, 2019, in Japan. Jae C. Hong/AP

A girl waits for the Communion during mass at the Immaculate Conception Church in Mocimboa da Praia, Mozambique, Aug. 25, 2019. The country welcomes the Pope on Sept. 4th. Marco Longari/AFP/Getty Images

Parade-goers walk in the annual West Indian Day Parade, Sept. 2, 2019, in Brooklyn, New York. The annual celebration of Caribbean culture is one of the largest of its kind and features dozens of floats and costumed participants that make their way down Flatbush Avenue. Yana Paskova/Getty Images

An indigenous girl from the Shanenawa tribe poses for a photo during a festival to celebrate nature and ask for an end to the burning of the Amazon, in the village of Morada Nova, near Feijo, Brazil, Sept. 1, 2019. Ueslei Marcelino/Reuters

A policeman pours water on the face of a protester who was detained in Hong Kong, Aug. 31, 2019. Protesters and police are standing off in Hong Kong on a street that runs through the bustling Causeway Bay shopping district. Jae C. Hong/AP

A player participates in the annual Brambles Sandbank cricket match at low tide in the Solent, Britain, Sept. 1, 2019. Hannah Mckay/Reuters

The Milky Way is seen behind a cabin, or Gelmerhuette, during a starry night in Bern, Switzerland, Sept. 3, 2019. The 'Gelmerhuette' is located in the Grimsel region of the Swiss Alps and offers a view down to Lake Gelmer. Anthony Anex/Keystone via AP

Police run past debris set afire by protesters in the Causeway Bay area of Hong Kong, Aug. 31, 2019. People demonstrating are defying a ban on rallying set by the local government in an attempt to take the streets back from protesters after thirteen straight weekends. Anthony Wallace/AFP/Getty Images
description: Find this week's top photos from around the globe in ABC News' This Week in Pictures slideshow
